results.title: Fun factory
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
This film tells of Mack Sennett’s rise from movie extra to king of comedy. It also looks at the style and the actors of the Mack Sennett studio, famous for its “Keystone Cops” films. Uses excerpts from films of the period.

results.title: Fun and games
results.creator_credit: Adam Hart-Davis, Colin Nobbs and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematical eye”.
This program consists entirely of short mathematical puzzles that students answer using problem-solving techniques. It also presents games that can be played in the classroom and a basic introduction to algebra.

results.title: Full time killer = Fulltime killer = Chuen jik sat sau
results.creator_credit: Milky Way Productions, Johnnie To, Andrew Lau and Ka-Fai Wai
results.brief_description: Two professional assassins engage in a battle of wits as they vie for the title of Asia’s number one hitman. Tok (Andy Lau), is an up-and-coming professional with an extravagant and flamboyant style, given to copying schemes of mass destruction from the movies and possessed of a diabolical wit. His antagonist is the Japanese-speaking O (Takashi Sorimachi), a discrete and efficient hitman who single-mindedly carries out his lethal tasks then fades into obscurity. The two men are preoccupied with the same woman, Chin (Kelly Lin), who, while Chinese, speaks fluent Japanese and runs a video store that rents films from Japan. Through a series of bloody encounters that take place across Asia, the assassins find themselves both allies and enemies, their rivalry culminating in fateful showdown. With ‘Fulltime Killer’ Johnnie To, a specialist of action cinema whose heterogeneous work oscillates between the grotesque (The Heroic Trio) and the minimalist (The Mission), has co-directed a crazed, exciting homage to the ‘bullet ballet’ sub-genre, laden with self-reflexive references and illogical narrative leaps. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Full moon in Paris = Les Nuits de la pleine lune
results.creator_credit: Margaret Menegoz, Eric Rohmer, Les Films Ariane, Les Films du Losange and Acteurs Auteurs Associes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comedies et proverbes”.
He who has two women loses his soul is the cryptic message at the start of this film in Eric Rohmer’s “Comedies et proverbes” cycle. The he of the message is, in this instance, a she - Louise who cannot bear being “loved too much”. And so she plays a game of seduction with her two aspiring lovers, one of whom she loves too, in her own way. And what if they get tired of waiting, of being available? Pascale Ogier won the best actress award at Venice in 1984 for her role as Louise. She is supported by Tcheky Karyo and Fabrice Luchini.
results.title_for_label: Full moon in Paris = Les Nuits de la pleine lune

results.title: Full metal jacket
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Stanley Kubrick
results.brief_description: Stanley Kubrick’s disturbing and darkly funny Vietnam war drama about the dehumanizing process involved in turning young men into trained killers is divided into two distinct acts. Based on Gustav Hasford’s “The Short-Timers”, the first part focuses on the slow descent into madness of a young recruit in basic training, Private Gomer Pyle (Vincent D’Onofrio). He undergoes a process of systematic torture, verbal abuse and cruel disciplinary measures administered by a sadistic drill Sergeant (Lee Emery). The second part shows the bastardization process in action as it follows Private Joker (Mathew Modine) as he navigates himself around the madness and senselessness of the Vietnam war. This isn’t the first time Kubrick has dealt with the inhumanities of war, having tackled similar themes in the brilliant ‘Paths of Glory’. With ‘Full Metal Jacket’ however, he achieves in presenting an absurd and chilling vision of hell on earth. Cast also includes Adam Baldwin, Arliss Howard, Dorian Harewood and Kevyn Major Hasford. Original music by Abigail Mead (Kubrick’s daughter Vivian Kubrick).

constellations_other.name: Hiding in plain sight
constellations_other.description: This print of upside-down heads is an early optical illusion featuring hidden characters. Movie studios have continued the tradition of playing with perspective in the bold designs, vivid colours and hidden meanings of film posters.

results.title: Full fathom five
results.brief_description: A study of marine life, taken from the best footage of four outstanding underwater photographers. There is no narrative, instead the film is accompanied by electronic rock music.

results.title: Full cycle
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Review: 27th year”.
With the present shortage of fuel in Britain, the bicycle has come into its own as a humane machine, efficient, and adaptable alike for work or pleasure. This general film on cycling shows the manufacture of bicycles, bicycle competitions, riding and safety.

results.title: Full circle: the work of Doris Chase
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth Wood, Perspective Films and Doris Chase
results.brief_description: Documentary on painter, sculptor and filmmaker, Doris Chase. Ms Chase explains her work including the development of her sculptural furnishings for modern dance groups into video film works.
